works.name: 21 April 2015 Low coupling and PUB/SUBs in our programs (workshop)
works.description: Workshop for pre-middle/middle programmers to help them understand an application architecture.

works.name: Products / basket implementation using pubsubs and modules
works.description: Demo app I'll be using for JavaScript architecture workshop

works.name: 5 March 2015 EPAM Open Javascript Community Meeting
works.description: Tech talks about WebComponents and Polymer.

works.name: 24 December Web components and Polymer (workshop)
works.description: Real-time coding of small, but useful weather application upon Polymer and Web Components concepts.

works.name: 8 November 2014 Week-end full-stack JavaScript with Poker and Poetess (workshop)
works.description: Real-time coding of multiplayer Draw Poker Game with Facebook Authorization. The whole application will be implemented using JavaScript stack of technologies. All participants can follow presenters on their notebooks and develop their own application.

works.name: JavaScript design patterns demo
works.description: Javascript design patterns demo application used for EPAM JavaScript Talks.

works.name: Another JavaScript challenge for programmers
works.description:
In each level you need to find out a function by it's input and output.
It is a single page javascript application. Connected with travis. Uses grunt for building.

works.name: JS Robot - Javascript challenge for developers
works.description:
In each level of jsrobot you need to write simple program on JavaScript to guide a robot to exit.

It is a single page javascript application written using HTML5 and CSS3 techniques - localstorage, history API etc. Connected with travis. Uses grunt for building. Written in a TDD way.

works.name: Rubics cube on CSS3 and javascript
works.description:
This is a prototype. Ugly code and some interesting conceptions:
  • You can use an international notation to program rubik's cube algorithms. Try pasting an algorithm from http://rubiks.wikia.com/wiki/Patterns into "commands" input and press "Execute" button.
  • Write commands and loop it N times
  • Write commands and loop it until the cube will be solved
